metadata.title: CVE-2022-36402 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: An integer overflow vulnerability was found in vmwgfx driver indrivers/gpu/vmxgfx/vmxgfx_execbuf.c in GPU component of Linux kernel withdevice file '/dev/dri/renderD128 (or Dxxx)'. This flaw allows a localattacker with a user account on the system to gain privilege, causing adenial of service(DoS).

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
